STORE FACILITIES
We offer a lot more than you think. Here are some of our additional facilities to help make your visit easier.

 * Electric vehicle charging [data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==]Electric vehicle charging [/gb/en/images/this-is-ikea/ikea-electric-vehicle-charging__1364313010593-s5.jpg]
   CAR CHARGING POINT
   We have charging points for our customers with electric cars.
   
   Find out more
   
   
   
   ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGING
    *  Electric vehicle charging [data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==]Electric vehicle charging [/gb/en/images/this-is-ikea/ikea-electric-vehicle-charging__1364313010593-s5.jpg] 
      At IKEA, we believe in having a positive impact on people and planet, therefore when visiting our store we encourage our
      customers to travel via sustainable modes of transport. IKEA and Ecotricity have been working together for five years
      offering an Electric Vehicle Charging service for free, which we believe has encouraged the take-up of electric cars in the
      UK.
      
      In order to continue to invest in Electric Vehicle Charging technology, Ecotricity have introduced a small fee for a rapid
      charge which customers need to pay in order to use the charging points across the country, including the charge points
      located on IKEA sites. Although Ecotricity are changing their pricing structure, the IKEA offer remains the same.
      
      In order to continue encouraging customers to use this mode of transport, a £6 voucher will be redeemable in IKEA stores on
      the same day. Customers simply need to show their Ecotricity email payment receipt at the IKEA checkout in order to receive
      a £6 discount off their total in-store purchase, terms & conditions apply.
      
      
    *  IKEA customer offer
      
      After you have charged your electric vehicle on an IKEA site, why not come into the IKEA store and enjoy a £6 discount off
      your total shop?
      
      All you have to do is show your Ecotricity email receipt (which you will receive after your 45 minute charge) at the
      checkouts and £6 will be deducted from your total spend*. The discount can only be redeemed in store on the day of the
      vehicle charge.
      
      
    *  * Terms and conditions apply, pleaseread here [/gb/en/ikea/electric-vehicle-charging/].
      
      
   
   
 * On site recycling [data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==]On site recycling [/gb/en/images/this-is-ikea/ikea-on-site-recycling__1364320636493-s5.jpg]
   ON SITE RECYCLING
   You can return recyclable waste, such as batteries and light bulbs at our recycling area.
   
   Find out more
   
   ON SITE RECYCLING
    *  On site recycling [data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==]On site recycling [/gb/en/images/this-is-ikea/ikea-on-site-recycling__1364320636493-s5.jpg] 
      The amount of Electrical waste thrown away in the UK is increasing each year, making it the fastest growing waste stream in
      the UK. Recycling reduces the environmental and health risks associated with sending electrical goods to landfill.
      
      
      We therefore offer our customers free take-back of batteries and bulbs in store.
      
      
   
   
 * Friendly WiFi [data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==]Friendly WiFi [/gb/en/images/this-is-ikea/ikea-friendly-wifi__1364320637413-s5.jpg]
   FREE WIFI
   Our free WiFi is available all over the store and we are proud to be members of the Friendly WiFi scheme!
   
   Find out more
   
   FREE WIFI IN-STORE
    *  Friendly WiFi logo [data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAP///wAAACH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAICRAEAOw==]Friendly WiFi logo [/gb/en/images/gb-img-fy15/ikea-friendly-wifi__1364320915110-s5.jpg] 
      To connect for the first time:
      
      1 - Switch on the Wi-Fi on your device and select 'IKEA Wi-Fi'
      2 - Register with your IKEA FAMILY card or email address.
      3 - Accept the terms and conditions, and start browsing!
      
      
      To re-connect the next time you visit:
      
      1 - Switch on the Wi-Fi and your device should recognize the 'IKEA Wi-Fi' and connect automatically.
      2 - Open your browser to accept the terms and conditions and you are back online!
      
      
      
      The Friendly WiFi symbol is designed to help children, young people and adults navigate their way through the high street
      and when they are making choices on days out and holidays, giving the option to use a 'Friendly WiFi' venue to ensure that
      the public WiFi that they are accessing is filtered and safe. It can be confusing for young people and children to
      understand what symbols mean, hence why the accreditation service has been launched to create one symbol which is easily
      recognised and gives the confidence that the WiFi is filtered and independently accredited. IKEA are proud to be members of
      the scheme and ensure their customers are safe whilst online in any IKEA store.
      
      Find out more [https://www.friendlywifi.com/]
      
      
   
   

SERVICES AT IKEA
We make it easy for you to pick up, take home and assemble your furniture by yourself. If you prefer, our optional services can
save you some time and energy.

SCHOOL CLOSURES
Sheffield schools will always do their utmost to stay open, however, closures and changes to opening times may occur due to
reasons such as bad weather.

If your school is not opening as usual, you should hear from your child’s school via their usual methods in the first instance.
This page will automatically update with the latest information that we receive from schools about their opening times.

You can register to receive email updates about changes to school opening times.

The information available on this page is also available on our Twitter account.


 

Please ensure you refresh this page to see the latest alerts.



LATEST PRIMARY SCHOOL CLOSURES  * View RSS feed
   [https://feed2js.org//feed2js.php?src=http%3A%2F%2Fcontent.govdelivery.com%2Faccounts%2FUKSHEFFIELD%2Fwidgets%2FUKSHEFFIELD_WIDGET_8.rss&desc=240&au=y&date=y&utf=y&html=y] 

LATEST SECONDARY SCHOOL CLOSURES  * View RSS feed
   [https://feed2js.org//feed2js.php?src=http%3A%2F%2Fcontent.govdelivery.com%2Faccounts%2FUKSHEFFIELD%2Fwidgets%2FUKSHEFFIELD_WIDGET_6.rss&desc=240&au=y&date=y&utf=y&html=y] 

LATEST SPECIAL SCHOOL CLOSURES  * View RSS feed
   [http://feed2js.org//feed2js.php?src=http%3A%2F%2Fcontent.govdelivery.com%2Faccounts%2FUKSHEFFIELD%2Fwidgets%2FUKSHEFFIELD_WIDGET_7.rss&desc=240&au=y&date=y&utf=y&html=y]

 *  Home [/] 
 *  Visit Sheffield [/visit] 

[/content/templates/images/9659/Image.jpg?rnd=778] A vibrant city bursting with character and creativity.
[/p/10/visit/things-to-see-and-do]KNOWN THE WORLD OVER AS “THE STEEL CITY”, SHEFFIELD WAS FAMED FOR ITS INDUSTRY IN THE HEYDAY OF
THE 1900’S AND REMAINS A CITY OF INNOVATION TO THIS DAY. HOWEVER THE SMOKING CHIMNEY STACKS ARE NO MORE AND INSTEAD YOU’LL FIND A
GREEN, MODERN CITYSCAPE SET AGAINST THE STUNNING BACKDROP OF THE PEAK DISTRICT NATIONAL PARK.

WE HAVE A FRIENDLY, INDEPENDENT AND ALTERNATIVE SPIRIT THAT YOU WON’T FIND IN OTHER CITIES, ALONGSIDE A THRIVING CULTURAL SCENE
BOASTING AWARD-WINNING THEATRE, BEER, MUSIC, FESTIVALS, STREET ART AND SO MUCH MORE. IT’S ALL HERE WAITING FOR YOU: WELCOME TO
SHEFFIELD.


[/content/templates/images/9660/Image.jpg?rnd=72] Things to See & Do [/p/10/visit/attractions] 
[/content/templates/images/9662/Image.jpg?rnd=133] Where to Stay [/p/20/visit/stay]

[/content/templates/images/9661/Image.jpg?rnd=164] Food & Drink [/p/25/visit/food-and-drink]

[/content/templates/images/9663/Image.jpg?rnd=729] Places to Explore [/p/11533/visit/explore] 
[/content/templates/images/9744/Image.jpg?rnd=145] Culture Guide [http://www.ourfaveplaces.co.uk/]

   weekend for your viewing…

Sheffield, located in South Yorkshire, England, is both a major industrial city and one of the greenest cities in the UK.
TripAdvisor travelers particularly recommend the Sheffield Winter Garden and the Botanical Garden. After dark, you’ll find a
lively bar and club scene, a testimony to the town’s large student population.Read more Read less Want to save up to 30% on your
Sheffield hotel?Shop Hotels [/Hotels-g186364-Sheffield_South_Yorkshire_England-Hotels.html]We check up to 200 sites for the latest
and lowest prices. * [https://static.tacdn.com/img2/x.gif] [/LocationPhotos-g186364-Sheffield_South_Yorkshire_England.html]

Sheffield [18] [https://www.sheffield.gov.uk/out--about/tourist-information.html] is a city in Yorkshire [/en/Yorkshire] in the
north of England [/en/England]. With a population of 551,800, it is one of the United Kingdom [/en/United_Kingdom]'s and Europe
[/en/Europe]'s biggest cities. Around 1.75 million people live in the wider metropolitan area, (South Yorkshire
[/en/South_Yorkshire]), which includes Rotherham [/en/Rotherham], Barnsley [/en/Barnsley], and Doncaster [/en/Doncaster].

The most geographically varied city in England, Sheffield is a major industrial, cosmopolitan and cultural centre renowned for its
green open spaces, creative talents, galleries, sport facilities and cutlery. Unlike many other cities its size in the United
Kingdom, Sheffield has a very large amount of public greenery, with trees outnumbering the human population approximately
three-to-one. As well as the extensive urbanisation, one third of the city's territory is rural national park land.

The city lies in the most southerly part of Yorkshire, with Derbyshire [/en/Derbyshire], Nottinghamshire [/en/Nottinghamshire],
and Lincolnshire [/en/Lincolnshire] to the west, south, and east. The nearest similar-sized cities (all 1 hour away or less, by
train) are Manchester [/en/Manchester] (west), Leeds [/en/Leeds] - Bradford [/en/Bradford] (north), York [/en/York] (north east), 
Hull [/en/Kingston_Upon_Hull] (east), and the Nottingham [/en/Nottingham] - Derby [/en/Derby] conurbation (south). The M1 motorway
runs past Sheffield's Meadowhall Shopping Centre to the east of the city centre, the beautiful Peak District [/en/Peak_District] 
extends to within the western city boundary, and the South Pennines area ("Last of the Summer Wine country") lies just to the
north.

UNDERSTAND[EDIT [/WIKI/EN/INDEX.PHP?TITLE=SHEFFIELD&ACTION=EDIT&SECTION=1]]
[https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/Sheffield_at_Night.jpg/375px-Sheffield_at_Night.jpg]
[/en/File:Sheffield_at_Night.jpg] [/en/File:Sheffield_at_Night.jpg]Sheffield City CentreSheffield is built on and in-between seven
hills, and it is thanks to this landscape that Sheffield exists today. Even before the Industrial Revolution, the villages around
Sheffield were established as centres of industry and commerce thanks to fast flowing rivers and streams that brought water down
from the Peak District. The valleys through which these flowed were ideally suited for man-made dams that could be used to to
power water mills. A walk along the Rivelin Valley from Malin Bridge tram stop or along the Porter Valley out from Endcliffe Park
towards the Peak District will reveal some of these old dams.

The city centre lies where these rivers and valleys meet. The city has expanded out along the valleys and over the hills between,
creating leafy neighbourhoods and suburbs within easy reach of the city centre. Each valley that stretches out from the city
centre has its own character, from the densely industrial Don Valley to the north-east, to the green and cosmopolitan residential
streets around the Ecclesall Road on the Porter Valley in the south-west.

Industry in the city really took off when the railways arrived, allowing for the mass import of raw materials and export of
finished products. The crucible technique of making exceptionally high quality steel was invented here by Benjamin Huntsman in
1852, and for decades it was to give Sheffield the economic advantage over other steel producing cities. Sheffield is still the
home to a number of cutlery and blade manufacturers (including Swann Morton), and Sheffield steel can be found in surgical
equipment and kitchen drawers the world over.

However, the economic recession of the 1980s hit Sheffield hard, and large numbers of workers were left unemployed by the changing
shape of heavy industry in Britain. The combination of the resilient spirit of Sheffield people in these bleak times made the city
famous in the black comedy 'The Full Monty', which was set and filmed in and around Sheffield. Sheffield is the largest city in
the county of South Yorkshire [/en/South_Yorkshire], and Sheffield residents are proud of their perceived character: South
Yorkshire [/en/South_Yorkshire] residents pride themselves on a warmth and hospitality that isn't found in other northern cities.
Visitors to Sheffield may find this most noticeable in the affectionate terms that slip into everyday conversation. Even when
making a simple purchase in a store or market, you can expect to be called 'love' at least once.

Sheffield is adapting as it becomes a more confident post-industrial city. Grand visions have routinely been proposed or initiated
by the city or county councils, and European funding has been used on a number of public infrastructure projects that have shaped
the city. This is nothing new, however, since many would argue that post-war town planners did more damage to the face of
Sheffield than the Luftwaffe did during the heavy nights of World War II aerial bombing. Bold housing projects such as the world
famous (and now listed) Park Hill made Sheffield famous for the feverish vision with which architects and planners sought to
reshape the city in the second half of the twentieth century. In reality, this left much of Sheffield with a poorly maintained
legacy of failed utopian concrete fantasies, but this braveness and edginess is cited by many as being a fundamental part of
Sheffield's character. Now, at the beginning of the twenty-first century, a number of commercial developers are making big marks
on the cityscape, with large apartment complexes that aim to correct the errors through planning policy of similar developments
seen in Manchester [/en/Manchester] and Leeds [/en/Leeds]. Whether the formula works in Sheffield remains to be seen: with so many
affordable and attractive suburbs within easy reach, it may be difficult to turn Sheffield's compact city centre into a mixed area
of commerce and residential properties.

ClimateJanFebMarAprMayJunJulAugSepOctNovDec Daily highs (°C) [/en/Metric_and_Imperial_equivalents] 6.4 6.7 9.3 11.8 15.7 18.3 20.8 
20.6 17.3 13.3 9.2 7.2 Nightly lows (°C) [/en/Metric_and_Imperial_equivalents] 1.6 1.6 3.1 4.4 7.0 10.0 12.4 12.1 10.0 7.2 4.2 2.6 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

See the 5 day forecast for Sheffield at the Met Office [http://www.metoffice.gov.uk/weather/uk/yh/sheffield_forecast_weather.html]
Sheffield is home to two universities (the University of Sheffield and Sheffield Hallam University) with excellent ratings in both
teaching and research, it is also proving to be an increasingly attractive place for graduates to settle in. Sheffield is
increasingly prosperous and economically active.

Culturally, Sheffield's location and edgy environment has nurtured a superb reputation for music. Sheffield is home to Joe Cocker,
Human League, Def Leppard, ABC, Baby Bird, Pulp, Arctic Monkeys, Milburn, Bromheads Jacket, The Long Blondes, and Little Man Tate
to name just a few. The larger-than-average student population (over 60,000) means that nightlife is always lively, and suitably
different to that of Leeds [/en/Leeds] and Manchester [/en/Manchester]. Sheffield's proximity to the Peak District National Park
(one third of Sheffield lies within the Peak District) makes it an ideal city base for an outdoor-orientated holiday.

TOURIST INFORMATION[EDIT [/WIKI/EN/INDEX.PHP?TITLE=SHEFFIELD&ACTION=EDIT&SECTION=2]]
 *  Sheffield tourist information centre, Winter Gardens, Surrey Street (Located next to the Winter Gardens on Surrey Street in
   the city centre.), ☎ +44 114 221 1900 ([email protected]), [1] [http://www.welcometosheffield.co.uk/]. M-Fri 9:30AM-5PM, Sa
   9:30AM-4PM.edit

GET IN[EDIT [/WIKI/EN/INDEX.PHP?TITLE=SHEFFIELD&ACTION=EDIT&SECTION=3]]
BY PLANE[EDIT [/WIKI/EN/INDEX.PHP?TITLE=SHEFFIELD&ACTION=EDIT&SECTION=4]]
[https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2c/Robin_Hood_Airport%2C_Finningley_-_geograph.org.uk_-_915175.jpg/300px-Robin_Hood_Airport%2C_Finningley_-_geograph.org.uk_-_915175.jpg]
[/en/File:Robin_Hood_Airport,_Finningley_-_geograph.org.uk_-_915175.jpg] 
[/en/File:Robin_Hood_Airport,_Finningley_-_geograph.org.uk_-_915175.jpg]Doncaster Sheffield Airport * Doncaster Sheffield Airport
   [http://www.dsaflights.co.uk], one of the youngest airports in the UK [19] [http://www.dsaflights.co.uk/] (airport code: DSA),
   is approximately 25 minutes' drive away from the centre of Sheffield. To reach Sheffield by public transport from the airport,
   take the Airport Arrow bus [20] [http://flydsa.co.uk/show_image.php?file_id=95] (every hour from 06.05 - 23.05 Monday to
   Saturday, 09.05 - 18.05 on Sundays) to Doncaster railway station and travel by train to Sheffield. Alternatively a direct bus
   to Sheffield city centre (737) operates a limited service, with a journey time of 45 minutes. 

Flights from Doncaster [http://www.dsaflights.co.uk/flights]

The airlines that serve the airport are:

 *  Aer Lingus [http://www.aerlingus.com/]: Boston, Dublin, Chicago, New York, Toronto.
 *  BH Air [http://bhairlines.com/]: Burgas.
 *  FlyBe [http://www.flybe.com/]: Dublin, Jersey, Alicante, Newquay, Paris CDG, Berlin, Amsterdam, Faro 
 *  Thomas Cook [http://www.thomascook.com/] Antalya, Dalaman, Enfidha, Palma. 
 *  Thomson Airways [http://flights.thomson.co.uk/]: Alicante, Burgas, Crete, Corfu, Dalaman, Faro, Gran Canaria, Ibiza, Jersey,
   Lapland, Larnaca, Malaga, Malta, Menorca, Montego Bay, Palma, Paphos, Prague, Reus, Rhodes, Salzburg, Sharm el Sheikh,
   Tenerife, Turin, Varna, Verona, Zakynthos, Zante.
 *  WizzAir [http://www.wizzair.com/] Bydgoszcz, Gdańsk, Katowice, Lublin, Poznań, Vilnius, Warsaw, Wrocław.
